meanings.definition: A brief, vigorous fight or quarrel.
meanings.sent1: The siblings had frequent dustups over who got to use the toy first.
meanings.sent2: The dustup between the two classmates was quickly resolved by the teacher.
meanings.sent3: During the family reunion, a dustup broke out over the last piece of cake.
meanings.sent4: The political debate turned into a dustup between the candidates.
meanings.sent5: The dustup in the playground left both kids with scraped knees.

meanings.sent1: The loud music caused a dustup in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The unexpected arrival of the celebrity caused a dustup at the event.
meanings.sent3: The cat's antics created a dustup among the other pets in the house.
meanings.sent4: The announcement of the test results caused a dustup of emotions among the students.
meanings.sent5: The sudden thunderstorm created a dustup of leaves in the yard.
